 Hello, I'm sorry for not processing your email in time. We are on the Dragon Boat Festival holiday. I have marked your email and our support staff will solve your problem for you as soon as possible after the holiday. I am very sorry for the delay. Sincere apologies!

 I have explained to you in 3 previous emails that I do not have a video of the issue.  I have removed the pedals from cockpit and they are very difficult to reinstall.  I have provided photos and a detailed description of the issue.  It has been 13 days since I emailed you and so far all I have received is repeated requests for photos and videos.  This entire process has been very frustrating and disappointing and I no longer am interested in your product.  Please provide me the information needed to return this defective product for a full refund or send me a new brake pedal.  Thank you.

Thank you for your understanding and support! 
 
   service@simsonn.com

Date: 2025-05-18 08:50 
 
To: General and sales enquiries
 
 
Subject: Re: Brake Pedal Issue 
  
  
 Thanks for the response. I apologize, but I do not have a video because I’ve already removed the pedal.  I Took a couple pictures of the pedal in case that might help. 
   
 This is the best description I can give the problem. I installed the throttle and pedal on my machine with the default red elastomers attached.  I was able to calibrate both the pedal and break with the Simsonn software but as soon as I touched the break, it would invert itself to 100%. Then, if I pushed on the break very hard, it would start to go down from 100 to maybe as far as 75. Using the invert brake setting in Assetto Corsa did not resolve this issue. 
   
 I found that if I cranked down the preload screw the 100% would start to diminish. So I swapped out the red elastomers with the blue and I put in a large spacer. This seemed to help as I was able to once again calibrate the pedal in the Simsonn software. It even appeared that the brake was working normally in the Simsonn software. However, with every game, the brake would not activate until it was 20 to 30% pushed and the in-game  braking would jump from 0 to 25%. No matter what I did, I couldn’t make the break work for that first 25%. 
 
   
 Also, when I would go back to the software, the pedal calibration seem to undo itself. It would be back to 100%. But then I could push it and it would fall to 75 and if I continue to push it a few more times it would drop back to zero. 
   
 I have made sure that the connector box is nowhere near any electrical outlets or other interference. 
   
 I’ve had to switch back to my thrustmaster pedals In the meantime.  This is incredibly frustrating and has cost me hours of troubleshooting and headaches. I apologize, but my patience is very thin with this pedal set.   
   
 Unless you have some easy fix that will be worth me spending the effort and two hours of putting the pedals back on the machine, I would appreciate if you would send me a new brake pedal. I haven’t given up on the product yet. I’m just hoping that maybe there is a defect in this one and the one you sent me will work great. I will be happy to return this brake in exchange for a new one. Thank you.   
   
 Chris Schillings

Hi,  We are very sorry for the inconvenience caused. Could you please provide some pictures or a video for us? Then we can check what the problem is 
   
 
   service@simsonn.com   
 
 
 
   
  
 
From: Chris Schillings
 
 
Date: 2025-05-14 01:04 
 
To: service
 
 
Subject: Brake Pedal Issue 
  
  
 Good Morning,   
 I recently ordered the Simsonn Pro Plus Pedal Upgrade set (order #SSN1424).  For unknown reasons I cannot get the brake pedal to calibrate properly.  The calibration works initially works normally, however when I push on the brake after calibration it immediately flips to 100% activated.  Nothing I do seems to change this issue.  The throttle works flawlessly.  I have troubleshooted the issue by; 
   
 1. Rebooting 
 2. Re-installing the app 
 3. Adjusting the polymers and spring tension 
 4. Swapping out elastomers 
 5. Using other software (FreeJoy and DiView) 
 6. Unplugging everything that may cause interference 
 7. Moving the system away from power sources 
   
 I have been able to get the pedal to calibrate by greatly ratcheting down the tension on the elastomers.  However this greatly reduces the travel of the brake.  And when I did this, the brake would travel 20% before even recording pressure.   
   
 I believe it may be time for a return unless you have any other suggestions.   
   
 Thank you, 
   
 Chris Schillings 
 (707) 239-8568 
 cwschillings@gmail.com

你好，Chris Schillings，  Hello, this issue is likely caused by adjusting the pedal damping, which requires a recalibration of the zero point (initial position).  That explains why the output doesn't start until you've pressed the pedal around 20% to 30%.  Please install ToDesk, a remote assistance tool — I can help you reconfigure the offset and fix the issue within a few minutes.
